definition: to scale (a height)/to ascend/to mount/to publish or record/to enter (e.g. in a register)/to press down with the foot/to step or tread on/to put on (shoes or trousers) (dialect)/to be gathered and taken to the threshing ground (old)
to record/to note/to memorize/to remember/mark/sign/classifier for blows, kicks, shots

sentences.english: They looked up at the registrar who started to get the already late proceedings under way.
sentences.chinese: 他们望着登记员，他已经开始准备迟到的登记程序。

sentences.english: And the cash registers in Lauscha keep ringing out.
sentences.chinese: 并且能听到劳沙的现金登记员在不停地送别游客。

sentences.english: The clerk said with his best southern planter's accent.
sentences.chinese: 房间登记员以最地道的南部种植园主的口吻回答。

sentences.english: R:You can contact the Estate Department on the fourth floor about getting a parking permit.
sentences.chinese: 登记员:你可以和四楼的营业部联系办理一张停车证。

sentences.english: Registrars checked the ID cards of prospective voters.
sentences.chinese: 登记员核对未来投票人的身份证。

sentences.english: R:May I know your room number?
sentences.chinese: 登记员:请问您的房间号码是多少？

sentences.english: R:May I show you to your room?
sentences.chinese: 登记员:我可以带您去你的房间吗？

sentences.english: The clerk shuffled reservation and room slips .
sentences.chinese: 登记员翻阅着预定单和住宿单。
登记员:欢迎你住进天津国际大厦。
登记员:你一定是Larson先生吧。
登记员:您是什么时候送洗的？

sentences.english: The registrar is the sole judge of whether he passes this test.
sentences.chinese: 登记员是唯一来评价他是否能通过这次测试。
